trans-unit.source: Establishing a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Establishing a Stored Access Policy

trans-unit.source: A stored access policy provides an additional level of control over shared access signatures on the server side.
trans-unit.target: A stored access policy provides an additional level of control over shared access signatures on the server side.

trans-unit.source: Establishing a stored access policy serves to group shared access signatures and to provide additional restrictions for signatures that are bound by the policy.
trans-unit.target: Establishing a stored access policy serves to group shared access signatures and to provide additional restrictions for signatures that are bound by the policy.

trans-unit.source: You can use a stored access policy to change the start time, expiry time, or permissions for a signature, or to revoke it after it has been issued.
trans-unit.target: You can use a stored access policy to change the start time, expiry time, or permissions for a signature, or to revoke it after it has been issued.

trans-unit.source: The following storage resources support stored access policies:
trans-unit.target: The following storage resources support stored access policies:

trans-unit.source: Containers.
trans-unit.target: Containers.

trans-unit.source: Note that a stored access policy on a container can be associated with a shared access signature granting permissions to the container itself or to the blobs it contains.
trans-unit.target: Note that a stored access policy on a container can be associated with a shared access signature granting permissions to the container itself or to the blobs it contains.

trans-unit.source: Share.
trans-unit.target: Share.

trans-unit.source: Note that a stored access policy on a share can be associated with a shared access signature granting permissions to the share itself or to the files it contains.
trans-unit.target: Note that a stored access policy on a share can be associated with a shared access signature granting permissions to the share itself or to the files it contains.

trans-unit.source: Queues
trans-unit.target: Queues

trans-unit.source: Tables and table entity ranges
trans-unit.target: Tables and table entity ranges

trans-unit.source: For more details on working with stored access policies, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on working with stored access policies, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c0d4fe58-e6f4-4a90-bad5-138f59967560" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Use a Stored Access Policy</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Creating or Modifying a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Creating or Modifying a Stored Access Policy

trans-unit.source: To create or modify a stored access policy, call the Set ACL operation for the resource (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="27ec7195-33fd-4fe6-9e15-dd575627115c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Queue ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="a68b978f-5cbe-4275-b42a-68b7f88ee968" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="032f3a38-db93-4673-ac7e-0434311e1240" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Share ACL</link>) with a request body that specifies the terms of the access policy.
trans-unit.target: To create or modify a stored access policy, call the Set ACL operation for the resource (<legacyItalic>i.e.</legacyItalic>, <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="27ec7195-33fd-4fe6-9e15-dd575627115c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Queue ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="a68b978f-5cbe-4275-b42a-68b7f88ee968" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Table ACL</link>, <link xlink:href="032f3a38-db93-4673-ac7e-0434311e1240" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Share ACL</link>) with a request body that specifies the terms of the access policy.

trans-unit.source: The body of the request includes a unique signed identifier of your choosing, up to 64 characters in length, and the optional parameters of the access policy, as follows:
trans-unit.target: The body of the request includes a unique signed identifier of your choosing, up to 64 characters in length, and the optional parameters of the access policy, as follows:

trans-unit.source: Table entity range restrictions (<codeInline>startpk</codeInline>, <codeInline>startrk</codeInline>, <codeInline>endpk</codeInline>, and <codeInline>endrk</codeInline>) cannot be specified in a stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Table entity range restrictions (<codeInline>startpk</codeInline>, <codeInline>startrk</codeInline>, <codeInline>endpk</codeInline>, and <codeInline>endrk</codeInline>) cannot be specified in a stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of five access policies may be set on a container, table, or queue at any given time.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of five access policies may be set on a container, table, or queue at any given time.

trans-unit.source: Each <languageKeyword>SignedIdentifier</languageKeyword> field, with its unique <languageKeyword>Id</languageKeyword> field, corresponds to one access policy.
trans-unit.target: Each <languageKeyword>SignedIdentifier</languageKeyword> field, with its unique <languageKeyword>Id</languageKeyword> field, corresponds to one access policy.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to set more than five access policies at one time results in the service returning status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: Attempting to set more than five access policies at one time results in the service returning status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Modifying or Revoking a Shared Access Signature
trans-unit.target: Modifying or Revoking a Shared Access Signature

trans-unit.source: To modify the parameters of the stored access policy, you can call the access control list operation for the resource type to replace the existing policy, specifying a new start time, expiry time, or set of permissions.
trans-unit.target: To modify the parameters of the stored access policy, you can call the access control list operation for the resource type to replace the existing policy, specifying a new start time, expiry time, or set of permissions.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your existing policy grants read and write permissions to a resource, you can modify it to grant only read permissions for all future requests.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your existing policy grants read and write permissions to a resource, you can modify it to grant only read permissions for all future requests.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the signed identifier of the new policy, as specified by the <languageKeyword>ID</languageKeyword> field, would be identical to the signed identifier of the policy you are replacing.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the signed identifier of the new policy, as specified by the <languageKeyword>ID</languageKeyword> field, would be identical to the signed identifier of the policy you are replacing.

trans-unit.source: To revoke a stored access policy, you can either delete it, or rename it by changing the signed identifier.
trans-unit.target: To revoke a stored access policy, you can either delete it, or rename it by changing the signed identifier.

trans-unit.source: Changing the signed identifier breaks the associations between any existing signatures and the stored access policy.
trans-unit.target: Changing the signed identifier breaks the associations between any existing signatures and the stored access policy.

trans-unit.source: Deleting or renaming the stored access policy immediately effects all of the shared access signatures associated with it.
trans-unit.target: Deleting or renaming the stored access policy immediately effects all of the shared access signatures associated with it.

trans-unit.source: To remove a single access policy, call the resource's Set ACL operation, passing in the set of signed identifiers that you wish to maintain on the container.
trans-unit.target: To remove a single access policy, call the resource's Set ACL operation, passing in the set of signed identifiers that you wish to maintain on the container.

trans-unit.source: To remove all access policies from the resource, call the Set ACL operation with an empty request body.
trans-unit.target: To remove all access policies from the resource, call the Set ACL operation with an empty request body.

trans-unit.source: Use a Stored Access Policy
trans-unit.target: Use a Stored Access Policy
